## Davis Anomaly Detector for Logs
Using the Davis Anomaly Detection app, you can automate query and analysis of your log data using Davis AI to identify and alert on anomalies.

#### 1. In the same notebook for **Log Anomaly Baselines**, after completing the DQL, open the side menu with `...` and select Open With.  Choose `Davis Anomaly Detection`.
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dynatrace-wwse/workshop-dynatrace-log-analytics/refs/heads/main/assets/images/log-davis-anomaly-detection_open_with_davis_anomaly_detection.png)

#### 2. Select the Simple Mode
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dynatrace-wwse/workshop-dynatrace-log-analytics/refs/heads/main/assets/images/log-davis-anomaly-detection_anomaly_detection_set_scope.png)

#### 3. Define Alert Conditions
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dynatrace-wwse/workshop-dynatrace-log-analytics/refs/heads/main/assets/images/log-davis-anomaly-detection_anomaly_detection_define_alert_condition.png)

#### 4. Add Details
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dynatrace-wwse/workshop-dynatrace-log-analytics/refs/heads/main/assets/images/log-davis-anomaly-detection_anomaly_detection_add_details.png)

#### 5. Check the GB scan size for the DQL Query (next to the Discard button)

#### 6. Press Create to save the anomaly detector
